thread.title: Dallas police find Cowboys memorabilia, stolen from storage
thread.title_full: Dallas police find Cowboys memorabilia, stolen from storage

title: Dallas police find Cowboys memorabilia, stolen from storage
text:
KLTV Closed Captioning Dallas police find Cowboys memorabilia, stolen from storage 
DALLAS (AP) - Dallas police have recovered thousands of dollars' worth of Cowboys memorabilia stolen from a fan's storage unit and sold. 
Police on Tuesday announced collectable jerseys from Troy Aikman, Roger Staubach and Tony Dorsett were recovered. 
Thieves in August broke into a storage complex and took $30,000 worth of framed and autographed memorabilia. 
A tip to the storage manager helped police locate an individual and recover some items. Police secured the name of another person, who was jailed in an unrelated case, and learned some of the valuable sports pieces were sold to employees at a Dallas hotel. 
Detective Craig Kier visited hotel workers and recovered most of the stolen property, for return to the owner. 
A suspect was charged Monday with burglary of a building. Further details weren't immediately available.
